quotes.quote: The whole aim of practical politics is to keep the populace alarmed (and hence clamorous to be led to safety) by menacing it with an endless series of hobgoblins, all of them imaginary.
It is of practical value to learn to like yourself. Since you must spend so much time with yourself you might as well get some satisfaction out of the relationship.
The practical importance of the preservation of our forests is augmented by their relations to climate, soil and streams.
So never lose an opportunity of urging a practical beginning, however small, for it is wonderful how often in such matters the mustard-seed germinates and roots itself.
In the practical art of war, the best thing of all is to take the enemy's country whole and intact; to shatter and destroy it is not so good.
Don't always be so reasonable and practical and sensible that you refuse to seize glorious opportunities when they show up and push the envelope as to what's possible for you.
In real life, the most practical advice for leaders is not to treat pawns like pawns, nor princes like princes, but all persons like persons.

The only objects of practical reason are therefore those of good and evil. For by the former is meant an object necessarily desired according to a principle of reason; by the latter one necessarily shunned, also according to a principle of reason.
You need to learn a practical lesson. Grit alone is not going to save you from sinking.
A practical botanist will distinguish at the first glance the plant of the different quarters of the globe and yet will be at a loss to tell by what marks he detects them.
There is the greatest practical benefit in making a few failures early in life.
Practical prayer is harder on the soles of your shoes than on the knees of your trousers.
Practical knowledge of what works and what doesn't work is much better. Theoretical knowledge is important, but I think practical knowledge works better.
The practical effect of a belief is the real test of its soundness.
The practical core of democracy, defined functionally, is the peaceful exchange of power between different groups of powerful political players arranged in parties.
Sometimes it is the simplest, seemingly most inane, most practical stuff that matters the most to someone.
Practical wisdom is what's called for in situations that have a moral dimension to them.
To be practical, any plan must take account of the enemy's power to frustrate it.
To be practical in life means to take everything seriously and nothing tragically.
Be practical as well as generous in your ideals. Keep your eyes on the stars, but remember to keep your feet on the ground.
Practical dreamers do not quit.
A practical girl never pines; she takes action.

Practical life teaches us that people may differ and that both may be wrong: it also teaches us that people may differ and both be right. Anchor yourself fast in the latter faith, or the former will sweep your heart away.
In practical life the wisest and soundest people avoid speculation.
In practical life we are compelled to follow what is most probable ; in speculative thought we are compelled to follow truth.
A practical man is a man who practices the errors of his forefathers.
The most practical thing in the world is common sense and common humanity.
The most practical information about life is sneered at by social planners.
In the practical use of our intellect, forgetting is as important as remembering.
The chief practical use of history is to deliver us from plausible historical analogies.
